definition: to congregate/to assemble/to mass/to gather together/to amass/to polymerize

sentences.english: It focuses on Ethernet services access, aggregation and transmission in metro area.
sentences.chinese: 它着重於以太網服務的接入，匯聚和城域網傳輸。

sentences.english: Before a type can be pooled, it must first be registered.
sentences.chinese: 在匯聚類型之前，首先必須註冊它。

sentences.english: They are canalized expressions of our instincts.
sentences.chinese: 文化是人類本能的匯聚表現。

sentences.english: Enzo wondered what point his series was converging toward?
sentences.chinese: 恩佐不知道他的系列正匯聚成什麼點？

sentences.english: Ashes of new homes, is gathering a new hope.
sentences.chinese: 浴火重生的新家園，正匯聚升騰起新的希望。

sentences.english: We are meeting at a time of crisis.
sentences.chinese: 我們在危機四伏之際匯聚在一起。

sentences.english: The beauty of Sanya, the beauty of the world, joined together brilliantly.
sentences.chinese: 三亞之美，世界之美，交融匯聚，閃耀啓幕。

sentences.english: The academies gathered the most excellent painters in the country.
sentences.chinese: 這樣，國家可以把全國最優秀的丹青妙手匯聚起來。

sentences.english: Shanghai World Expo is also a coming-out party for robots from around the world, Xinhua reported.
sentences.chinese: 據新華社報道，上海世博會也是各國機器人的匯聚地。

sentences.english: The lake is fed by several small streams.
sentences.chinese: 這湖是由幾條小溪的水匯聚而成的。

sentences.english: Converge homocentric aspiration, and transfer homocentric power.
sentences.chinese: 匯聚同心的追求，傳遞同心的力量。

sentences.english: Today we gather here to grandly celebrate the International Women's Day.
sentences.chinese: 今天我們匯聚一堂，隆重慶祝三八國際婦女節。

sentences.english: And thousands upon thousands made an ocean.
sentences.chinese: 直到千萬道細流匯聚成一片海洋。

sentences.english: Countless small streams converge to form a large river.
sentences.chinese: 每一條大河都是由無數的汀瀅匯聚而成的。

sentences.english: I'm made of no end of prime of stars, trees and grass, mountains and rivers.
sentences.chinese: 我是由無數星辰日月草木山川的精華匯聚而成的。

sentences.english: We possess a batch of scientific innovative projects with our own intellectual property right.
sentences.chinese: 擁有自主知識產權的一批科創型項目匯聚。

definition: to collect/to compile/to converge/also written 彙集|汇集[hui4 ji2]
peak/apex/world best/number one/finest (competitors)/top (figures in a certain field)
domestic and international/at home and abroad
to gather (in a crowd)/to converge/to swarm
to assemble/to concentrate/to mass/to build up/to marshal
collecting together (of distinguished people or exquisite objects)/to gather/to assemble
to join up/to dock/a joint (between components)
conferences and exhibitions, abbr. of 會議展覽|会议展览[hui4 yi4 zhan3 lan3]
to enter and garrison/(fig.) to establish a presence in
innovation/to bring forth new ideas/to blaze new trails
